Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk rh-mongodb32
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: rh-mongodb32 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated rh-mongodb32 packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available as a part of Red Hat Software Collections 2.3 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented database system classified as a NoSQL database. This Software Collection includes the mongo-java-driver package.
The rh-mongodb32 packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.2.10, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1376475, BZ#1386229)
Additionally, the rh-mongodb32 Software Collection is now available also for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6. (BZ#1356073)
For details, see the Red Hat Software Collections 2.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
Users of rh-mongodb32 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
